data.name: Add_Label4
data.value: Recurrence: This is a recurring appointment.

data.name: ClientEvents_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates how to use client-side events in WebSchedule.

data.name: ClientEvents_Description2
data.value: Double-click on a time slot or day to add an appointment.

data.name: ClientEvents_Description3
data.value: Try to add an appointment on a weekend.

data.name: ClientEvents_Description4
data.value: The validation performed in the ActivityDialogEdit client-side event will prevent the appointment from being saved.

data.name: ClientEvents_Description5
data.value: Resize an existing appointment in the DayView by mouse dragging from the bottom. Resize the appointment to exceed two hours in length.

data.name: ClientEvents_Description6
data.value: The validation performed in the ActivityUpdating client-side event will prevent the action.

data.name: DayViewGeneral_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates the basic properties of WebDayView.

data.name: DayViewGeneral_Description2
data.value: Select a StyleSheetFileName from the first dropdown list to change CSS styles.

data.name: DayViewGeneral_Description3
data.value: Change values in the editors to observe the affects of the corresponding properties.

data.name: DayViewGeneral_Description4
data.value: Double-click on a time slot to create an appointment.

data.name: DayViewGeneral_Description5
data.value: After creating an appointment, drag it into another time slot by clicking on the left side of the appointment.

data.name: DayViewGeneral_Description6
data.value: Change the length of the appointment by resizing it from the bottom.

data.name: DayViewGeneral_Description7
data.value: Alter appointments and navigate with a more fluid experience by enabling Smart Callbacks on WebScheduleInfo.

data.name: DayViewStyles_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates the numerous Style properties of WebDayView.

data.name: DayViewStyles_Description2
data.value: Double-click on a time slot to create an appointment.

data.name: DayViewStyles_Description3
data.value: Select ActivityHoverStyle from the top dropdown list.

data.name: DayViewStyles_Description4
data.value: In the "Border" panel, select Color: Blue, Style: Double, and Width: 5, and click the "Apply Border" button.

data.name: DayViewStyles_Description5
data.value: Hover over the appointment to see the effects of your changes to the ActivityHoverStyle.

data.name: DayViewStyles_Description6
data.value: Experiment with other styles and settings on this form to see how the various styles are affected.

data.name: DayViewStyles_Description7
data.value: Appointments can be moved by dragging from the left side, or resized from the bottom.

data.name: DayViewStyles_Description8
data.value: Note some properties may not affect every Styles. For example, Style.Height will not affect ActivityHoverStyle, but it will affect DayHeaderStyle. BackColorwill not visibly affect areas with a background image.

data.name: FullPage_Description1
data.value: This sample includes all the WebSchedule view controls on one page.

data.name: FullPage_Description2
data.value: Double-click on a day or time slot to create a new appointment.

data.name: FullPage_Description3
data.value: Mouse drag or resize an appointment in the WebDayView to reschedule or change its length.

data.name: FullPage_Description4
data.value: If you have added a Resource using the Admin sample, use the toolbar to change the active resource; otherwise, just use the "Unassigned" resource.

data.name: FullPage_Description5
data.value: Change the StyleSheetFileName by selecting it from the dropdown list or clicking the change color button in the toolbar.

data.name: FullPage_Description6
data.value: New in 2006.2: AJAX Smart Callback functionality has been enabled, which eliminates postbacks while changing the selected day, as well as adding, updating, and removing appointments.

data.name: FullPage_Description7
data.value: New in 2006.2: WebScheduleInfo supports activities recurring on a daily, weekly, monthly, or yearly basis. Add an appointment normally to any WebSchedule view control, and click the new "Recurrence" button on the Add/Edit Appointment dialog to set it's recurrence pattern.

data.name: InfoProperties1_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates WebScheduleInfo's collections, and shows synchronization of smart callback-enabled WebSchedule views with WebDateChooser on the client.

data.name: InfoProperties1_Description2
data.value: Select a resource from the dropdown list. If you have not yet added a resource using the ManageResources sample, use the "Unassigned" resource.

data.name: InfoProperties1_Description3
data.value: Set WebScheduleInfo's ActiveDay property to a day with appointments (these days appear in bold on the WebCalendarView.)

data.name: InfoProperties1_Description4
data.value: Select an active day using the WebDateChooser dropdown.

data.name: InfoProperties1_Description5
data.value: Select an active day on WebCalendarView.

data.name: InfoProperties1_Description6
data.value: Click the "Fetch Resources" button to populate the listbox with WebScheduleInfo's VisibleResources collection.

data.name: InfoProperties1_Description7
data.value: Click the "Fetch Appointments" button to populate the listbox with the active resource's appointments on the active day.

data.name: InfoProperties1_Description8
data.value: Click the "Count Appointments" button to count the number of appointments on the active day.

data.name: InfoProperties2_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates using some of the properties of WebScheduleInfo in code.

data.name: InfoProperties2_Description2
data.value: Change the DefaultReminderInterval to 00:25:00 and then observe how that value is used when adding a new appointment.

data.name: InfoProperties2_Description3
data.value: Change the current CultureInfo and observe the changes in how dates and times are displayed in the MonthView.

data.name: InfoProperties2_Description4
data.value: Change the TimeDisplayFormat from default and observe how the CultureInfo settings are overridden by that setting.

data.name: InfoProperties2_Description5
data.value: Change the FirstDayOfWeek property and observe how it changes the display of rows and columns in the MonthView.

data.name: InfoProperties3_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates using some time-of-day WebScheduleInfo properties pertaining to the WebDayView, and active day synchronization between multiple WebSchedule controls.

data.name: InfoProperties3_Description4
data.value: Enable smart callbacks so the active day can be synchronized in both views without a postback to the server.

data.name: InfoProperties3_Description5
data.value: Modify the TimeDisplayFormat to see how it affects the time-of-day labels in WebDayView.

data.name: InfoProperties3_Description6
data.value: Modify the WorkDayEndTime to 12:00 PM and click the "Change Workday Hours" button to see how it affects the highlighted timeslots in WebDayView.

data.name: Login_Description1
data.value: This is the login page for the WebSchedule Full Page Sample.

data.name: Login_Description2
data.value: Select a resource from the DropDownList. If you have not yet added a Resource using the Admin sample, just use the "Unassigned" resource.

data.name: Login_Description3
data.value: Click the "Log In" button to go to the WebSchedule Full Page Sample.

data.name: MonthViewGeneral_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates the basic properties of WebMonthView.

data.name: MonthViewGeneral_Description2
data.value: Select a StyleSheetFileName from the first dropdown list to change CSS styles.

data.name: MonthViewGeneral_Description3
data.value: Change values in the editors to observe the affects of the corresponding properties.

data.name: MonthViewGeneral_Description4
data.value: Double-click on a day to create an appointment.

data.name: MonthViewGeneral_Description5
data.value: Edit appointments and switch between months more smoothly by enabling Smart Callbacks on WebScheduleInfo.

data.name: MonthViewStyles_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates the numerous Style properties of WebMonthView.

data.name: MonthViewStyles_Description2
data.value: Double-click on a day to create an appointment.

data.name: MonthViewStyles_Description3
data.value: Select AppointmentStyle from the top dropdown list.

data.name: MonthViewStyles_Description4
data.value: In the "Border" panel, select Color: Blue, Style: Double, and Width: 5, and click the "Apply Border" button.

data.name: MonthViewStyles_Description5
data.value: Observe the changes to the border of appointments in the WebMonthView.

data.name: MonthViewStyles_Description6
data.value: Experiment with other styles and settings on this form to see how the various styles are affected.

data.name: MonthViewStyles_Description7
data.value: Note that some properties may not affect some Styles. For example, Style.Height will affect AppointmentStyle, but it will not affect ActiveDayStyle. BackColor will not visibly affect areas with a background image.

data.name: MultipleResources_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates a tabbed view of appointments for different Resources.

data.name: MultipleResources_Description2
data.value: Click the "Add appointment at Now to all users" button to add an appointment at the present time to the Resource on each tab.

data.name: MultipleResources_Description3
data.value: Click the tabs below to view appointments for different Resources.

data.name: MultipleResources_Description4
data.value: Click the enable smart callbacks checkbox to improve the responsiveness of the DayView.

data.name: MultipleResources_Description5
data.value: Select the "Javier in WebUserControl" tab and change the display style of the DayView using the dropdown list below.

data.name: MultipleResources_Label6
data.value: Add appointment at Now to all users

data.name: MultipleResources_Label7
data.value: Enable smart callback and navigation animation

data.name: ResourceAdmin_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates administering the WebSchedule Database through the API.

data.name: ResourceAdmin_Description2
data.value: Use the empty row at the top of the Grid to add a new Resource.

data.name: ResourceAdmin_Description3
data.value: Select a row and press the delete key on the keyboard to delete a Resource.

data.name: ResourceAdmin_Description4
data.value: Click on a cell to edit a Resource.

data.name: SingleResources_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates the use of multiple WebSchedule View controls in a tabbed view, displaying Activities for a single Resource.

data.name: SingleResources_Description2
data.value: Change the Active Resource using the DropDownList at the bottom of the page.

data.name: SingleResources_Description3
data.value: Click on the different tabs to change the current View.

data.name: SingleResources_Label8
data.value: Enable smart callback and navigation animation

data.name: TimeZoneLanding_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates WebSchedule's time zone functionality.

data.name: TimeZoneLanding_Description2
data.value: This is the "landing page," which allows the user to select which Resource and time zone to use.

data.name: TimeZoneLanding_Description3
data.value: WebSchedule allows for the user's time zone to be changed.

data.name: TimeZoneLanding_Description4
data.value: The WebSchedule API allows the application developer to write code relative to the user's time zone, or the time zone on the web server, or UTC (Coordinated Universal Time).

data.name: TimeZoneLanding_Description5
data.value: Select a Resource from the first dropdown. If you have not yet added a Resource, just select "Unassigned."

data.name: TimeZoneLanding_Description6
data.value: Select the time zone of your choice from the second dropdown. Observe the client-side functionality which switches back to the web client's current time zone.

data.name: TimeZoneLanding_Description7
data.value: Click the "Submit" button to log in using the selected Resource and time zone.

data.name: TimeZoneLanding_Description8
data.value: Observe the various times which are written to the next page; some of these times will vary by time zone, and others will not.

data.name: WeekViewGeneral_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates the basic properties of WebWeekView.

data.name: WeekViewGeneral_Description2
data.value: Change the various FormatString properties by selecting frequently used formats from the dropdown lists.

data.name: WeekViewGeneral_Description3
data.value: Set the CaptionHeaderVisible property to False to see the WeekView without the caption header area.

data.name: WeekViewGeneral_Description4
data.value: Change the image files which are used by clicking the appropriate buttons.

data.name: WeekViewGeneral_Description5
data.value: Select a StyleSheetFileName from the first dropdown list to change CSS styles.

data.name: WeekViewGeneral_Description6
data.value: Enable smart callbacks on WebScheduleInfo to create and modify appointmentson the client-side without postbacks.

data.name: WeekViewStyles_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates the numerous Style properties of WebWeekView.

data.name: WeekViewStyles_Description2
data.value: Double-click on a day to create an appointment.

data.name: WeekViewStyles_Description3
data.value: Select AppointmentStyle from the top dropdown list.

data.name: WeekViewStyles_Description4
data.value: In the "Border" panel, select Color: Blue, Style: Double, and Width: 5, and click the "Apply Border" button.

data.name: WeekViewStyles_Description5
data.value: Observe the changes to the border of appointments in the WebWeekView.

data.name: WeekViewStyles_Description6
data.value: Experiment with the other styles and the other controls on this form to see how the various styles are affected.

data.name: WeekViewStyles_Description7
data.value: Note that some properties may not affect some Styles. For example, Style.Height will affect AppointmentStyle, but it will not affect ActiveDayStyle. BackColor will not visibly affect areas with a background image.

data.name: SingleResources_Tooltip
data.value: WebScheduleInfo and DataProvider are located in Page outside of UltraWebTab. Views are in tabs and they are connected to DataProvider in codes behind.

data.name: MultipleResources_Tooltip
data.value: Every tab besides WebDayView contains local instances of WebScheduleInfo and DataProvider. They are connected to each other on codes behind.

data.name: Recurrence_Open
data.value: This is a recurring appointment. Do you want to open this occurrence or the series?

data.name: WebSchedule_MultipleResources_Description
data.value: This sample demonstrates the new Multiple Resources View feature. This feature allows you to easily display of schedule information related to more than one resource.

data.name: WebSchedule_GenericDataProvider_DataSet_Description
data.value: This sample shows the new Generic Data Provider feature. The purpose of this feature is to allow the customer to pull data from any supported data source (including simple list).

data.name: WebSchedule_GenericDataProvider_DataSource_Description
data.value: This sample shows the new Generic Data Provider feature. The purpose of this feature is to allow the customer to pull data from any supported data source (including simple list). This Sample does not support CRUD operations.

data.name: WebSchedule_GenericDataProvider_DataSource_Title
data.value: WebSchedule - Bind GenericDataProvider To Access Data Source

data.name: WebSchedule_GenericDataProvider_ICollection_Description
data.value: This sample shows the new Generic Data Provider feature. The purpose of this feature is to allow the customer to pull data from any supported data source (including simple list).

data.name: WebSchedule_MultiDayEvtBanner_Description
data.value: This sample shows the new Web Schedule Multi Day Event Banner feature.

data.name: WebSchedule_SelectVisibleResources_Description
data.value: This sample demonstrates how you can show or hide the visible resources

data.name: WebSchedule_SideBySide_Description
data.value: This sample demonstrates how you can create your own custom User Control using WebSchedule controls. Side-by-Side user control positions separate Day and Month views for each selected resource side-by-side on another within the area of the control. As more resources are displayed, other displayed resource calendars are made smaller in order to accommodate the new resources.
